comment.author: 47014872@N00
comment._content: Emmanuel FREMIET - (1824 --1910) "Jeune éléphant pris au piège" ( entre 1877 et 1878 ) crée pour l'Exposition universelle de 1878. Dimensions : 2,22 m x 3,60 m x 3,12 m - Actuellement sur le parvis du  Musée d'Orsay,à Paris.  Emmanuel FREMIETsur Wikipedia

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Hi Yann Seitek, We just got word back from our researcher, Ed: In a book on the 1900 Paris Exposition, “Paris exposition reproduced from the official photographs taken under the supervision of the French government, comprising more than three hundred and fifty photographic reproductions,” there is a photo of the Trocadero Park which shows the elephant sculpture. The sculpture was probably at both expositions.

comment.author: 14578355@N02
comment._content: This is wonderful! So special to see the an image from the original Trocadero setting! Such a small chance of finding this image on the Brooklyn Museum website, but with the Flickr connection, it's so easy! I'm very appreciative of The MB presence on Flickr.

comment.author: 70323761@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Emmanuel Frémiet, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 47014872@N00
comment._content: About an other Fremiet's sculpture on Trocadéro: " l'élan" ( the moose ) in 1900 1900 - " Derrière l'élan de Frémiet (Trocadéro)" by Henri Rivière(1864-1951) in "Les 36 vues de la Tour Eiffel" (entre 1888 et 1902) ---- Fonds Eiffel /Droits d'auteur : (C) ADAGP Crédit photographique : (C) RMN (Musée d'Orsay) / René-Gabriel Ojéda

comment.author: 47014872@N00
comment._content: The elephant sculpture was ordered in 1877 for the exhibition of 1878. It belonged to the decor of the garden of the first palace of Trocadéro. This palace has been destroyed in 1937 for an other universal exposition. The elephant, in front of the "palais du Trocadéro" (Wikipedia). On the other side, there was the Rinoceros sculpture from Alfred Jacquemart; Actually, in front of " Musée d'Orsay" L'élephant et le rhinocéros
